properties.name: The Coffee Academics
properties.Open Time: Monday – Friday 08:30 – 17:30/ Saturday Closed/ Sunday & Public Holiday Closed
properties.Description: Self-serviced cafe offering specialty coffee, sandwiches, salads and pastries

properties.name: Starbucks Coffee
properties.Open Time: Monday – Friday 07:30 – 21:00/ Saturday 08:00 – 20:00/ Sunday & Public Holiday 11:00 – 18:30
properties.Description: Self-serviced cafe offering salad, Sandwiches, Bakery, Dessert, Coffee, Grab-n-go

properties.name: Main Library
properties.Description: The Main Library comprises an all-rounded collection of materials in the arts, humanities, architecture, social sciences, and science and technology, giving vital support to teaching and research in the University.
properties.Open Time: Monday – Thursday 9:00am - 7:00pm/ Friday – Sunday 9:00am - 5:00pm

properties.name: Chi Wah Learning Commons
properties.Open Time: Level 1 Monday - Sunday (Including public holidays) 8:00 am - 6:00 am/ Level 2 Monday - Sunday 8:00 am - 11:00 pm
properties.Description: he 6000 square meter Chi Wah Learning Commons (智華館) is located at the podium levels of the University’s Centennial Campus.  The facility, which spreads over three levels, is a technology-rich, shared or common space in which students, teachers and others can come together to interact, and participate in various kinds of learning activities held there.

properties.name: Music Library
properties.Open Time: Monday – Thursday 1:00pm - 7:00pm/ Friday – Sunday Closed
properties.Description: The Music Library is a comfortable and well-equipped research library that supports the curriculum and research of the Department of Music, as well as broad musical interests and activities of the University community.

properties.name: Lui Che Woo Law Library
properties.Open Time: Monday – Thursday 9:00am - 7:00pm/ Friday – Sunday Closed
properties.Description: The University of Hong Kong Lui Che Woo Law Library is one of the subject branch libraries of the University Libraries. It provides study and research facilities for the academics, students and postgraduates of the Faculty, and other staff and students of the University.

properties.name: Education Library
properties.Open Time: Monday – Thursday 9:00am - 7:00pm/ Friday – Sunday Closed
properties.Description: The Education Library, established in 1978, is one of the branch libraries of the University Libraries.  It provides study and research facilities for the academics, undergraduates and postgraduates of the Faculty of Education, as well as other members of the University.

properties.name: KK 1F&2F - The Curve
properties.Open Time: Monday - Sunday (Including public holidays) 8:00 am - 11:30 pm
properties.Description: The Curve is located on the first and second floors of K.K. Leung Building. The facility is a common space in which students, teachers and others can come and study.

properties.name: KB 1F - The Oval
properties.Open Time: Monday - Sunday (Including public holidays) 8:00 am - 11:30 pm
properties.Description: The Oval is located on the first floor of Knowles Building. The facility is a common space in which students, teachers and others can come and study.

properties.name: University Health Service - UHS
properties.Open Time: Monday - Friday 8:40 am - 5:00 pm/ Saturday 8:25 am - 12:45 pm/ Sunday & Public Holidays Closed
properties.Description: The University Health Service provides for the health needs of students, staff, dependants and retired staff with the aim of promoting and maintaining their physical and psychological well being through the provision of accessible and cost-effective primary health care and health education.

properties.name: Cedars Counselling
properties.Description: Cedars counselling provided free psychological counseling services to students to help students overcome mental unwellingness
properties.Open Time: Monday – Thursday 9:00am – 5:45pm/ Friday 9:00am – 6:00pm/ Saturday - Sunday Closed

properties.name: Bijas Vegetarian
properties.Open Time: Monday – Friday 11:30 – 20:00/ Saturday & Public Holiday 11:30 – 20:00/ Sunday Closed
properties.Description: Self-serviced (Buffet Style, Collect-and-pay, charge by weight); Chinese Style Vegetarian, Coffee, Fresh Juice

properties.name: Gourmet Asia
properties.Open Time: Monday – Friday 08:00 – 15:30/ Saturday 08:00 – 15:30/ Sunday & Public Holiday Closed
properties.Description: Self-serviced fast food; South-East Asian Cuisine

properties.name: Olivers Super Sandwiches
properties.Description: Self-serviced fast food, offering daily signatured hamburger, pasta, salad.
properties.Open Time: Monday – Friday 08:30 – 15:30/ Saturday Closed/ Sunday & Public Holiday Closed

properties.name: University Museum and Art Gallery
properties.Open Time: Tuesday - Thursday 9:30 am - 6:00 pm/ Friday - Monday Closed
properties.Description: The University Museum and Art Gallery is located at 90 Bonham Road, next to the University of Hong Kong's East Gate entrance. Its exhibition galleries occupy the Fung Ping Shan Building as well as the first floor of the TT Tsui Building, where also the Museum Store is housed on the ground floor.

properties.name: Geological Museum
properties.Open Time: Monday - Friday 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm/ Saturday - Sunday Closed
properties.Description: The Stephen Hui Geological Museum is the first and only geological museum in Hong Kong. It is located on the ground and first floors of the James Hsioung Lee Building, in the University of Hong Kong Main Campus. The museum is part of the Department of Earth Sciences

properties.name: The Bridge
properties.Open Time: Temporarily Closed
properties.Description: Staff restuarant

properties.name: Vending Machine
properties.Description: Offers an assortment of crunchy snacks, cookies, chocolates, soft drinks and teas

properties.name: The Good Grade Pond
properties.Description: 龟(turtle) in Cantonese is pronounced similar to grade. There are many turtles in this pond, which can bring good luck to study work.

properties.name: Vniversity
properties.Description: On HKU's Tang Chi Ngong School of Chinese building, the English word "university" is spelled rather strangely. It is not a typo. This is actually an imitation of Latin writing. The ancient Romans often used V instead of V when carving large U.

properties.name: Visitor and Information Center
properties.Open Time: Monday - Saturday 9:30 am - 5:00 pm/ Sunday 11:00 am - 5:00 pm
properties.Description: Here visitors or students can buy a series of souvenirs from HKU, such as sweaters, jewelry, badges, etc.

properties.name: Lily Pond
properties.Description: Before the construction of Lily Pond in the 50s, the area where Lily Pond lies had been a green meadow and already a chill-out place for students. Although the meadow vanished due to the campus development in the 80s, the Lily Pond has still been maintained and conserved as an important place for HKU members. The garden was named after Mr. Mong Kwok Ping, father of Mr. William MW Mong, a major donor of HKU, in 1985.  In late 2003, the University erected a statue of Dr. Sun Yat-sen at the garden.

properties.name: The Red Wall
properties.Description: The Red Wall, the most prominent location on the Centennial Campus, is a must-visit photo spot for visitors to the University of Hong Kong. The logo of the University of Hong Kong is engraved on the red wall.

properties.name: ParknShop 百佳超市
properties.Open Time: Temporarily Closed
properties.Description: The only supermarket on campus, you can buy fruit and vegetable snacks, as well as various daily necessities and stationery.

properties.name: HKU East Gate
properties.Description: Go down from the elevator of kkl to reach east gate, which can lead to pokfulam road, and then go down to water street.

properties.name: Exit E2
properties.Description: Go down from the stairs of Swire building to reach Pokfulam Road.

properties.name: Exit E1
properties.Description: Vniversity locates at here.

properties.name: Exit E3
properties.Description: Directly lead to Kadoorie Biological Sciences Building

properties.name: HKU Station Exit A
properties.Description: A1 is on ground floor and A2 is on footbridge.

properties.name: HKU West Gate
properties.Description: Get down through the elevator of composite building to reach West Gate on Pokfulam Road.

properties.name: Centennial Gate
properties.Description: Centennial gate leads to HKU Station C1 gate through the footbridge.

properties.name: Library Corner
properties.Open Time: Monday – Thursday 9:00am - 6:30pm/ Friday – Sunday 9:00am - 4:30pm
properties.Description: A special study area within the main library.

properties.name: Chong Yuet Ming Fountain
properties.Description: Yuet Ming Fountain is next to University Museum and Art Gallery The University of Hong Kong and is located in Hong Kong.

properties.name: Piano
properties.Description: A colorful piano that anyone can play.

properties.name: Piano Room
properties.Description: Book through portal

properties.name: Exit S1
properties.Description: Go up to the peak through the graduate house exit.

properties.name: Sun Yat-sen Place
properties.Description: Sun Yat-sen Place, the largest outdoor area at the Main Campus. Commonly recognised as “Happy Park” among HKU students, it has been a popular venue for major academic, social and cultural activities, including the Joint-university Mass Dance and the annual graduation class photo shoot.

properties.name: Simon K.Y Lee Hall
properties.Description: In 1985, funding was provided to The University of Hong Kong to establish the Simon K. Y. Lee Hall, a residential hall on campus that accommodates 300 students.

properties.name: Lady Ho Tung Hall
properties.Description: Since the establishment in 1951, Lady Ho Tung Hall remains as the only female residential hall in the University of Hong Kong. It locates in the student village I.

properties.name: Starr Hall
properties.Description: Founded in 2001 with the help of the Hong Kong Jockey Club. It is the largest residential hall in HKU, accommodating 500 students.

properties.name: Ricci Hall
properties.Description: Ricci Hall, situated at 93 Pok Fu Lam Road, is one of the oldest residential halls at the University of Hong Kong. It is a boys only hall, with great history and deep heritage.

properties.name: Swire Hall
properties.Description: Located in the east side of the campus, Swire Hall built on November 11, 1980 and named after the Swire Group, which funded the construction.

properties.name: Lee Chi Hung Hall
properties.Description: Lee Chi Hung Hall is the only co-educational non-residential hall in the University. It is located on the ground floor of the Chong Yuet Ming Amenities

properties.name: Centennial Garden
properties.Description: The Centennial Garden was completed in 2012, together with the Centennial Campus, to maximise the green coverage of the campus. In the Centennial Garden stands the Bricks Wall displaying the names and stories of the supporters of the Bricks Campaign for Centennial Campus developments.

properties.name: Shun Hing College
properties.Description: Shun Hing College is one of the HKU residential colleges, located at Jockey Club Student Village III, Kenndy Town. It is also called the A building.

properties.name: Chi Sun College
properties.Description: Chi Sun College is one of the HKU residential colleges, located at Jockey Club Student Village III, Kenndy Town. It is also called the B building.

properties.name: Lap-Chee College
properties.Description: Lap Chee College is one of the HKU residential colleges, located at Jockey Club Student Village III, Kenndy Town. It is also called the C building.

properties.name: New College
properties.Description: New College is one of the HKU residential colleges, located at Jockey Club Student Village III, Kenndy Town. It is also called the D building.

properties.name: HKU Lee Shau Kee Hall
properties.Description: Lee Shau Kee Hall opened its doors at the end of August 2005. It is located in the Jockey Club Student Village II. The first affiliated student association was established among three new halls.

properties.name: Morrison Hall
properties.Description: The old male-only hall was demolished in 1968. The new Morrison Hall is re-established in 2005 with the aid from the old-Morrison alumni, located next to the Flora Ho Sport Centre. After St. John's and Lugard Halls, Morrison Hall was the third men's hostel built for students.

properties.name: HKU Suen Chi Sun Hall
properties.Description: Suen Chi Sun Hall was newly established in September 2005 together with the other two new halls as part of the Jockey Club Student Village II. It is next to the Flora Ho Sport Centre.

properties.name: Flora Ho Sports Centre
properties.Open Time: Monday - Sunday 7:30 am - 10:30 pm
properties.Description: The Flora Ho Sports Centre offers non-academic sport & recreation, health & fitness and competitive sports programmes.

properties.name: Stanley Ho Sports Centre
properties.Open Time: Monday - Sunday 6:30 am - 10:30 pm
properties.Description: Located on Sha Wan Road, the Stanley Ho Sports Centre offers non-academic sport & recreation, health & fitness and competitive sports programmes.

properties.name: C Active
properties.Open Time: Monday - Friday 7:30 am - 7:00 pm
properties.Description: Located in Centennial Campus, the C Active Sports Centre offers non-academic sport & recreation, health & fitness and competitive sports programmes.

properties.name: B Active
properties.Open Time: Monday - Friday 7:30 am - 10:00 pm/ Saturday 7:30 am - 8:15 pm
properties.Description: Located near to the HKU Station B1 Exit, the B Active Sports Centre offers non-academic sport & recreation, health & fitness and competitive sports programmes.

properties.name: Yu Chun Keung Medical Library
properties.Open Time: Monday – Thursday 9:00am - 7:00pm/ Friday – Sunday Closed
properties.Description: The Yu Chun Keung Medical Library, formerly the Lee Hysan Medical Library, is named in memory of the late Mr Yu Chun Keung for his generous donation and support. Completed in January 2002, it is designed as a state-of-the-art facility in the Faculty of Medicine Building, well equipped with sophisticated information technology to provide a virtual learning environment conducive to study and research.

properties.name: Lee Hysan Hall
properties.Description: Named after renowned land developer Lee Hysan and founded in 1992. Unity, Harmony, Choice and Responsibility, Positive

properties.name: Wei Lun Hall
properties.Description: Founded with the help of the Wei Lun Foundation in 1994. Located on Sasoon Road.

properties.name: R.C. Lee Hall
properties.Description: Founded with the help of Richard Charles Lee in 1992. Located on 6 Sassoon Road. The founding warden is Dr. Robert Chung, who was the former director of the Public Opinion Programme of the University of Hong Kong. The hall motto is Liberty with Responsibility, Unity in Diversity.
